samples.context: The importance of DNA copying during reproduction is that: (i) It is responsible for the transmission of parental characteristic to its offsprings. (ii) It also leads to certain genetic variation.
samples.question: What does DNA copying transmit to offspring?

samples.context: The importance of DNA copying during reproduction is that: (i) It is responsible for the transmission of parental characteristic to its offsprings. (ii) It also leads to certain genetic variation.
samples.question: How does DNA copying contribute to genetic variation?
